rComments: He was quite rude to students who wanted to visit his office hours and ask questions. Was only nice towards students who asked "above and beyond" type of questions. Did not provide enough contexts on how to study for his term tests. Poorly designed tutorials.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Bayer is solid. Chill dude, kinda scary, but teaches really well. Exams are straight forward expect the multiple choice can be tricky. Take your time doing masterings and practical work, the questions appear again in examinations.
He is very helpful with homework questions. Explanations are organized and clear. He is passionate about teaching.

Great lectures, very clear with explanations and helpful in office hours, however tests can be difficult especially with short answer explanations, course work is heavy with mandatory concept maps for PHYB52 (optional in PHYC54), online reading quizzes and lecture reflections, two midterms and a final. Overall good if you want to actually learn.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: In all honesty, Bayer is a pretty good lecturer. He explains concepts really well, and you get participation marks for answering the questions he asks in lectures. However, he is a very intimidating professor and if you don't say things the way he wants, he will come off as condescending. Otherwise, do the practice problems and you should be good.

He is very nice and respected. His lecture's are amazing !! If you study hard from the beginning of the semester then you are fine. His test are hard but fair ! if you study the homework, reading quizzes, go to lectures and pay attention to discussion questions, do the assigned and study the practical questions then you are definitely fine.

He renewed my interest in physics. However, his exams are deliberately tricky and based on a lot of conceptual thinking. Long answer problems require a complete solution for at most 3/4 of the marks. He's strict in terms of course organization and deadlines but tries his best to deliver good lectures and engage students. Could be less intimidating.

Amazing. Knowledgeable, VERY organized. He does seem intimidating in lecture and if you are distracting those around you he WILL call you out, but one-on-one he's very kind and understanding. Very detail-oriented and tests are quite difficult; often the questions combine many different concepts. Many of the marks come from explaining your work.

Professor Bayer makes lectures very interesting and engaging. Would definitely take a course with him again. Though he is very picky about the details, his tests are not too hard and if you keep up with the homework and reading, you will have ample time to write the necessary descriptions to get full marks.

Amazing professor, dedicated: to students ,and to inspiring a love of physics in students. However, beware: 90% of his exams are based on your communication style. Even if you are a prodigy (with Dr. Bayer, many may feel this way) getting the right answer is 0.05% of the mark. Do your homework to know how to communicate in the way he requires!

Prof. Bayer is an amazing lecturer, physics is exciting for the few hours a week spent in his class. However, his exam questions are extremely tricky, and hard. I decided to drop his course after the second midterm, but I will still be auditing the course because of his teaching style. He's very detail-obsessed so be careful.
Excellent prof! He explains everything so clear. Midterm and final are hard.
He's Awesome!

He is an amazing prof. Hands down best prof that I have ever seen in my entire life. His passion towards physics makes you want to learn more! He is so approachable and he does everything in his power to help you, but its on you to ask for the help and keep up with the work, if you fall behind, you are done!

Amazing professor, one of my favourites. He provides lectures to address the course materials and teaches us information extended from the assigned readings. He provides questions to help increase your understanding and thinking. It can be a good way to get a good mark iff you work for the mark which he had layed out the path for you.

Prof. Bayer showed me the importance of creativity, he has an in-depth understanding of the course, and often creates interesting questions (similar question but use different methods to solve) to test my knowledge. If you want to get good grade on his course, do everything he asked you to do, and solve questions he gave you
Good professor and very professional. He is fair in the evaluations, but you'll have to keep up with the work. If you can't do that, then don't bother taking this course.
He is a very responsible and hard working instructor.
Very rude, very intimidating when asking questions.
Excellent prof. He really cares about his students. He explains everything so clearly. I think physics is hard and I did well in the course because he is always willing to help. Best prof ever!
very good teacher explains rather than just assigning work

Mad respect for this guy. He stopped lecture and told a girl to stop texting and switch off her phone. So dedicated to helping students understand the material rather than just lecturing. This guy can teach! And English isn't even his first language, yet he speaks it excellently.

Made an tough course EXTREMELY interesting and simple. Teaches complex topics in simple ways EVERYONE can understand. Very approachable in office hours too. Fantastic lecturer! MAKE HIM A PROFESSOR AT UTSC!
Very helpful made sure students understood what he was talkin about.
Good Prof, bad bad course.
Really good teacher. Very kind and concerned about the well being of his students. Made physics interesting. Midterm was hard. He doesn't solve enough examples.

Great professor.  He goes out of his way to help accommodate for students' learning curve.  Our class was really small and he adjusted to our needs.  He was very approachable and interactive from the beginning to the end.
I couldn't say enough good things about Dr. Bayer.  My interest in physics went from zero to a hundred in no time, thanks to his captivating and enthusiastic teaching style.

Excellent Professor. I came into class not knowing a thing about physics and I came out knowing a lot. His style of teaching gets students involved. He motivates his class, and everyone can have fun learning in his course. Would definitely like to see him in some future UTSC physics classes.
Bad professor.
Johann Bayer is an excellent professor who makes learning Physics easy and fun! I definitely did not have such a positive outlook on Physics as a subject prior to being taught by Prof Bayer!

This was my best experience in all my years at UTSC. This course was very difficult but Johann Bayer made it interesting and always found time to make sure we were on the right track. PLEASE keep him on staff for future physics courses...it would be great if he were to teach PHYA10 - take it from personal (not so great) experience, we NEED him!
No Comments

No matter how dumb you are, you are guaranteed to do well in this class if you put a consistent effort in and go for help when you needed. Extremely helpful during office hours, everything is at once clear as a bell. He has the midas touch when teaching. He barks a little, but doesn't bite...
